title: City Of Minneapolis Suing HGTV Star Nicole Curtis

text:
City Of Minneapolis Suing HGTV Star Nicole Curtis March 22, 2017 6:44 PM By Kate Raddatz Filed Under: Kate Raddatz , Nicole Curtis , Rehab Addict 
MINNEAPOLIS (WCCO) ‚Äî A popular reality TV star is being sued by the City of Minneapolis. 
The lawsuit is the latest step in a failed home redevelopment project, a WCCO Investigation first exposed two years ago. 
Court documents reveal Nicole Curtis has failed to follow the contract on a North Minneapolis property she‚Äôs owned since 2012. 
Curtis is the star of HGTV‚Äôs ‚ÄúRehab Addict‚Äù, in which she saves historic and broken down homes. 
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a blight on an otherwise great block with amazing neighbors and beautiful homes,‚Äù Jonathon Lundberg, from Minneapolis, said. 
Curtis bought the Jordan neighborhood home for just $2, and agreed under contract to redevelop the property into a single family home within 12 months. The lawsuit filed by the City of Minneapolis in January claims Curtis ‚Äúfailed to substantially complete the Minimum Improvements on the Property.‚Äù It also says Curtis hasn‚Äôt paid property taxes or maintained insurance. 
‚ÄúShe has made a lot of promises,‚Äù Lundberg, who lives next to the home, said. 
Curtis has been commenting on the lawsuit on Twitter: I love when people who sit on their rears doing nothing put 2cents in regarding the work others are doing üôÇ #minneapolis#smh 
‚Äî Nicole Curtis (@nicolecurtis) March 21, 2017 
On Twitter Curtis also said she had been paying taxes and maintaining insurance on the property: The thing is ‚ÄìI hoard house parts and every bit of documentation about those houses. pic.twitter.com/thgUYOlix4 
‚Äî Nicole Curtis (@nicolecurtis) March 22, 2017 
WCCO reached out to both Curtis and her manager but have not heard back for comment. Kate Raddatz facebook Follow Kate Raddatz joined the WCCO-TV team in April 2013, but it wasn't her first time inside the newsroom. She worked as the "Good Question" intern in college. An Excelsior native and proud Gopher grad, she's thrilled to be telling stories in the place...
